name: San Diego Marriott Gaslamp Quarter

reviews.text: I stayed here one night on my way to Mexico. Check in was smooth and quick. The room was typical Marriott style, clean and spacious. We were able to walk out in the evening with plenty of dinner options close by. In the morning we walked around the neighborhood where we found a artisans street fair and a nice cafe for breakfast: Cafe 222. Close to the water and safe, I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in great walking area. Would return.

reviews.text: I had a great experience at this hotel. The staff is very helpful and friendly - really made my stay. Check-in was speedy, my room was ready early, and the hotel was very clean. Updated, nice bathroom and comfy beds. Would have liked a refrigerator in the room, and I had some difficulty with the internet. Restaurant was good and served generous portions. Location was perfect because I was close to restaurants and shopping, as well as the convention center.
reviews.title: Definitely Recommend This Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed for several days/nights and from the time we arrived until we checked out we had a wonderful stay. The staff is super friendly, the room is clean and comfortable, the location was unbeatable. Petco park and the shops of the Gaslamp are right there!! Truly one of the best vacations we have been on. Loved it!
reviews.title: Comfortable rooms, excellent location, super staff and a fantastic overall stay at the Marriot Gaslamp.

reviews.text: Great location near everything. Convention Center, ballpark and lots of resteraunts. Roof top bar is an experiance in itself. Want to go back to just relax and watch a game. Short taxi from the airport.
reviews.title: Location is every thing

reviews.text: Excellent location to restaurants, convention center and water front.
reviews.title: SLAS2012

reviews.text: Really enjoyed the stay at Marriott Gaslamp-the location is perfect for walking wherever you'd like to go, the view of downtown was amazing-I was on the 9th floor; and the service was outstanding.
reviews.title: Another Great stay at Marriott!

reviews.text: Took a winter vacation with my wife and daughters to get away from the Midwest cold. The hotel was recommended to us by a close friend.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the curbside reception, to the front desk, to room staff, everyone was friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: My Daughters Wedding December 03, 2011

reviews.text: The 22nd floor rooftop bar overlooks center field of the Padres Stadium. It is a equally spectacular for the morning sunrise and coffee or Happy Hour and the sunset. We enjoyed both more than once.
reviews.title: Great Location, Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location. It is an inexpensive, 10 minute cab ride from the airport. You do not need a car unless you traveling a long distance. There is a multitude of excellent restaurants and sports bars in walking distance from the hotel. We took the bus to the zoo. It was a simple trip.
reviews.title: Great location, very clean, and nice staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ive stayed at may marriotts and they are known for their service. I felt that this trip to this hotel was not the same. My husband and I went to spend a few relaxing days after the wedding. We live in Orange County and used to live in SD. I've stayed at the other 2 Marriotts downtown and they were much better than this one.
reviews.title: Not the service I expected at Marriott

reviews.text: When we checked in took awhile for someone to acknowledge us and help us. We asked if we could upgrade to a suite and the lady told us the diffence in price that we would pay. We didnt find out until the next day that she misquoted the price. That was very frustrating! After that, we walked to our room, I was shocked to see that the hallway of our floor was a mess. There were trays and messes outside of almost everyones room. When we left 3 hours later, all the mess was still there. I felt like we were walking through a kitchen! Not what I expect to see and I nice Marriott.
reviews.title: Great Gaslamp location

reviews.text: During our check out, we tried to use a gift card that someone gave us for our wedding and the front desk guy said, oh, well, its going to take me 15 plus minutes to use this so do you just want to put it on your card and keep the gift card. Really?? I was shocked and said yes we will wait. He got annoyed and said, well I have to call the manager. It took the front desk manager 10 minutes to get there. Finally after 20 minutes, we were able to check out.
reviews.title: Service needs improvement

reviews.text: We wont be going back there on our next visit
reviews.title: Great stay for Petco, convention center, or Gaslamp.

reviews.text: We chose the Marriott Gaslamp for its location and was not disappointed. It's location between the ballpark and Gaslamp quarter was great for us. Walking distance to the convention center, Trolley, and quarter. We were there four nights beginning New Year's Eve. The party went from the ground floor to the roof top lounge. New years day came and the hotel had completely been restored to normal use quite a feat given the amount of decorations, food serving areas, and crowd control structure that was in place the night before. Concierge lounge was well appointed. Overall enjoyed my stay and look forward to future stays.
reviews.title: Recommended hotel for location, friendly staff, two thumbs up!

reviews.text: great gaslamp location close to everything, disapointing view, the bay view is really a view of petco park and omni hotel and hard rock hotel with a sliver of the bay viewable. the coronado bridge did look nice at night. Warning..no rewards points when using expedia :-(
reviews.title: great location but over priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wi fi is free in lobby but waaay too much air freshener could not sit in lobby without chocking...fortunatly room didnt have too much scented air freshener, nice bed and bathroom, decent but crowded fitness center, nice view from roof top lounge,
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectation
Great Location...walking distance to everything...Very Nice Hotel
reviews.text: the good: great location, nice bed and bathroom, runners are a block from bay trail to go run..newer hotel so in good shape still, easy walk to gaslamp, good breakfast at mary janes cafe around corner
the bad: over priced, prkg expensive, interent expensive
reviews.title: Smaller room than expected but comfortable overall

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Marriott Gaslamp Quarter on Christmas Day. We were very impressed with all aspects of the hotel. All the staff we encountered were so professional and friendly (Valet, Bell Boy, Front Desk, Restaurant).
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great stay with my girlfriend in San Diego. Despite comments from other travelers about the loud music from the rooftop bar, we did not hear anything in our concierge level room overlooking the water. In fact, we were impressed by the sound-proofing of the room. The hotel is in a great location in the Gaslamp District and we were able to walk around the area without use of a car.
reviews.title: Good Modern Hotel with Well-Insulated Concierge Level Rooms

reviews.text: Attended a convention in April 2010 and stayed at this hotel. In my opinion, this hotel was just OK. The thing I liked best was the location - right in the middle of the Gaslamp Quarter. Plenty of restaurants, nightlife, sports and great views of San Diego bay and downtown. My criticisms of this property are with the cleanliness and maintenance of the room items, common areas and room service (food). The bed covers had dark stains in them and the coffee pot was broken. A call to the front desk quickly resolved the coffee pot issue. The room service (food) had good response time, but the food was cold and didn't taste all that great to my wife and I. We recommend the Broken Yoke restaurant, right around the corner, for breakfast. In terms of the common areas, the carpet in the hallway (19th floor) looked like it needed either a good cleaning or replacement. The internet connection offered in the room was VERY low bandwidth (56Kbps) - remember dialup? The hotel had a memo in the room stating they were updating their WiFi and apologized for the internet service.
reviews.title: an "OK" hotel

reviews.text: Excellent hotel service! Restaraunt was fantastic for breakfast (did not get to have dinner there). The hotel has 2 bar areas, one down by the restaurant which was fantastic, and a rooftop bar called Altitude which was amazing! I was there for work but definitely took advantage of the great location and great service of this hotel. Would highly reccommend it!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel service! Restaraunt was...

reviews.text: We took a few days vacationa nd checked in. We were bummbed there was no pool, but the bar on the roof made up for it! It was the trendy spot to be! Hotel was very clean and staff very accomodating. The concierge was fantastic! She went out of her wway to help arrange a wine tour to temecula and car service to La Jolla. The hotel had a small hotel feel, unlike any other Marriott. Everythign in the gas lamp is just a few blocks away. Great choice, would return! PS the internet did not work well while we were there...they said they are working on it.
reviews.title: Great location, great service

reviews.text: I recently organized a Dining Out for my sqaudron. Of the five venues I presented to the wardroom the Gaslamp Marriott offered the best setup and value and it was chosen very decisively by the JO's.
reviews.title: Come here if you want to have a Dining Out!

reviews.text: I stayed here for a conference and overall it was a nice stay. Very close to Petco Park, the Gaslamp district, and conference center, with plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. The negatives about the hotel is that we were right next to the elevator so we could hear it go up and down all night, I guess that's why there was a noise reduction machine in the room! It was expensive but very clean and up to date. I took in a Petco Park tour and we went to the Zoo, which was really nice. Also, the Gamlamp district was cool and trendy. A taxi to/from the airport runs $15. I would have given it a 5 if I wasn't next to the elevator and if the beds were larger and pillows more comfortable.
reviews.title: Pricey, but good locale
Gas Lamp San Diego
reviews.text: Does not have a area for guests to wash clothes and parking cost $32 a day. Not good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But there is a rooftop bar at the Hotel and you can watch the Padres play from there.
reviews.title: Very impressed

reviews.text: As a local to San Diego, we stayed at the Marriott for a "stay-cation" over a long weekend. I was quite pleased with the value we got from this hotel. 1 night, breakfast for 2, free valet and a gas card for just over $200. The room was extremely clean, very nice decor (the bathroom in particular), comfortable bed and in a great location. The staff was a little "out of it" and not as welcoming as I have experienced elsewhere. However, I would stay here again without a doubt.
reviews.title: The reviews are accurate: Great place, great stay

reviews.text: Booked the hotel through Priceline.com for $72 USD/night. ($82.13 including all taxes and fees). Arrived at San Diego International Airport at 10:30 p.m.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The rooms were great, but I wish they had mini refrigerator and microwave oven. The valet parking staff were excellent and go out of their way to make you feel special with smile on there faces. We were traveling with 11 high school senior students and they were treated with respect and all the staff's go above and beyond to make your trip enjoyable.
reviews.title: What a great services we received...

reviews.text: WOW, what a great service.
reviews.title: Exceptional service by your hotel staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would like to personally thank Lindsey Kehrer, Convention Services Manager, who handled our Frito-Lay West Division Summerline Meeting. She was exceptional with handling all details of our meeting, making my job easy. Although John Parker validated Marriott Gaslamp Quarter as a Pepsi Pour hotel, Lindsey followed-up and made certain that only Pepsi product was served during our meeting. This was only one of the many times Lindsey gave full attention to our meeting arrangments.
reviews.title: Boutique Marriott in The Heart of It All!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will recommend both Lindsey Kehrer and the Gaslamp Quarter to our headquarters meeting planners and to other Frito-Lay personnel who might hold meetings on the West Coast.
reviews.title: Excellent location, ambiance, and service

reviews.text: Thank you,
reviews.title: Excellent stay as always

reviews.text: The hotel fit my needs very well. However checking in was slow. Had to wait three hours to get my room. Also the workout room was adequate. Carpeted floor and not enough cardio equipment. The rooms are comfortable and the staff friendly and attentive.
reviews.title: Recent Stay

reviews.text: Pretty nice hotel with great access to the convention center and the gaslamp district. The roof top bar is a nice touch and if you go there while a baseball game is in progress, you get a free view of the game.
reviews.title: Nice Perks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel during a few days before and after NYE 2012. Absolutely love the location. It's within walking distance to everything Gaslamp has to offer and short taxi or trolley ride to most everything in SD that we cared to visit.
reviews.title: Great location for NYE

reviews.text: The experience was consistent to other Marriott properties we have stayed at over the years. The gave out free internet access to Gold/Platinum elite members, which was nice, but we were disappointed that only Platinum received free breakfast vouchers when the lounge is closed.
reviews.title: Friendly staff and great location

reviews.text: Only thing we felt was missing was a pool and/or hot tub. We knew they didn't have one but just say. :)
reviews.title: Marriot Gaslamp - a perfect stay

aka: San Diego Marriott Gaslamp Quarter Hotel
description: Fully reinvented the ultra-stylish San Diego Marriott Gaslamp Quarter has quickly become the premier luxury hotel in the heart of the lively Gaslamp Quarter. Adjacent to PETCO Park, Home of the San Diego Padres, and two blocks from the San Diego Convention Center. Boasting a sophisticated modern design and breathtaking Ocean, San Diego skyline and baseball park views, home to Soleil @k Restaurant, Latitude Lounge & ALTITUDE Sky Lounge our award winning open-air rooftop hotspot.
